result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony D. Beder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality-"Repeater"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

miscConds.notes: AODA/treatment and any other counseling per agent.

Random UA's per agent with any positive results being reported to the Sauk County DA's Office.  No contact w/A.T. or her immediate family or her residence w/o written consent from the agent.  DNA sample to be provided unless one has already been provided in this case.  Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

from Atty Varner w/4 letters attached

Defendant Anthony D. Beder in court with attorney Brent W. Varner.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin and w/intern Cody McConnell.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Court notes letters received.  Both sides have parties that wish to make statements.  Atty Varner notes that the State has been asked to provide photos of the injuries to the Court prior to sentencing but he is objecting.  Court responds.  A.T. makes statement.  M.T. makes statement.  T.B. makes statement.  K.R. makes statement.  State provides VIS and parties review it.  State makes recommendations.  Short recess for Atty Varner to talk to DE.  Back on the record, Atty Varner makes argument on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court sentences.

Ct 2:
Probation for one year

Defendant Anthony D. Beder appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  State request cash bond with conditions.  Gives warrant history.    Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date. $750.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: NO contact with A.R.T., her family or her residence.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless a valid Rx and use accordingly.  May return to premises one time to pick up personal property with law enforcement.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:45 am.  Return date scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
